I still made paradox. iff I kill george lucas, I lose intrest in space, making me not to have joined th forums, causing me not to kill george lucas, causing me to watch star wars, causing me to like space,causing me to join the forums, causing me to kill george lucas

so still my paradox
<sending data="" stream:="" "active="" scan-negative="" matter"=""></sending>

The Novikov Self-Consistency Principle denies you all your paradoxes. 

Hey, don't look at me, I don't make the rules.

I claim a hill in a universe which is a replica of this one, and accordingly contains no provisions for time travel.

I kill everyone and everything jebs rockets 

my empty universe and duplicate universe

i set up a defense in my universe so that I case if an attack It will self destruct every thing no matter what

I travel back in time and kill greening galaxy, and send in a squad of special ops and they take down your universe. I then claim a random hill.

my outside-of-universe-hill

I use a massive tachyon pulse to collapse all universes, planes of existance, and alternate timelines into one universe that is under my total dominion.

My single-universe hill. 

> 
> I would've repped you for this ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)
> Best,
>

Would've?

> 
> Would've?

 Sadly there are no rep points in the game forum. But the E.T. reference was definitely rep-worthy.

Best,

-Slashy

> 
> I travel back in time and kill greening galaxy

You try once again to close a timelike curve, but fail to do this because time travel is still impossible. I retain my hill.

> 
> Sadly there are no rep points in the game forum. But the E.T. reference was definitely rep-worthy.
> Best,

Ah. Didn't know that. Thanks. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

my rocket chugging hill

I drain the fuel out of the tanks. No rocket-hill for you!

my crator

My dome.

my lava pit

My newly formed asteroid belt around the Sun.
